commit_message:
Make subprocess chdir instead of changing global state

Have each subprocess call change its working directory instead of
shifting the working dir for the entire process.

Change-Id: Ia1ada14bac7bc6b3b006c1ef8930192761111877

commit_message:
Initial commit

This patch adds the core panels (Cisco Dashboard and Firewalls),
dev install script, basic documentation, and testing.

There is a fairly large amount of extra "stuff" left in, due to the
copy/paste nature of the setup. Specifically, the tests have a lot of
the horizon test code in which is unecessary, but temporary with the aim
of getting up and running quickly.

Change-Id: I5fdce186df09e1168e8d52abfec17e0c20a64031
Partially-Implements: blueprint initial-setup

subject: Fix the warning message for Cinder volume size
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-12 19:30:53.000000000', 'files': ['translator/hot/tosca/tosca_block_storage.py', 'translator/hot/translate_inputs.py'], 'message': 'Fix the warning message for Cinder volume size

The correct unit for valid Cinder volume size in TOSCA is GiB.
The warning message was updated to reflect this.

Change-Id: I14619a4cc7e2745f6e1bc7412742832337913c5b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix the warning message for Cinder volume size

The correct unit for valid Cinder volume size in TOSCA is GiB.
The warning message was updated to reflect this.

Change-Id: I14619a4cc7e2745f6e1bc7412742832337913c5b

commit_message:
Add a probetest for HUP/reload

This would have been enough to catch the regression, and we can extend
them as we work on any future ehancements to our process management.

Change-Id: I9a1b57aa15663380c45cf783afc8212ab4ffbace

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-12 21:44:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Avoid blocking on subprocess during rug shutdown

Currently the rug cannot be cleanly killed. It looks like its

Change-Id: I4a69f8a7e410e39c3abea4b3f2fdb8813814177b
Closes-bug: #1451949
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-12 22:12:50.000000000', 'files': ['akanda/rug/main.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/test_main.py'], 'message': 'Avoid blocking on subprocess during rug shutdown

commit_message:
Avoid blocking on subprocess during rug shutdown

Currently the rug cannot be cleanly killed. It looks like its
blocking on some un-terminated sub-processes.

This ensures that the rug api is terminated on shutdown, and also stops
the notification publisher.

Change-Id: I4a69f8a7e410e39c3abea4b3f2fdb8813814177b
Closes-bug: #1451949

commit_message:
Add ML2 configs to local.conf.sample of ML2

To be able to run multiple network types, q-agt must be enabled and
other type drivers specified.  In this patch, the common case of
'openvswitch' mechanism driver and 'gre'/'vxlan' type drivers are added
to local.conf.sample for convenience.

Partially Implements: bp/clean-up-devstack-plugin
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

Change-Id: Ib843936378135f73a463f95e5378ffd62f7c4cff

subject: development-stack Doc Update
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-27 11:28:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'development-stack Doc Update

This patch changes how a development stack should be setup,
referencing the use of the bootstrap and run-playbook scripts
instead of the gate-check-commit script as this is generally
better practise. We have found that people end up running
the gate-check-commit script repeatedly instead of just
running a specified playbook.

This patch also adds the ceilometer containers to the
development stack diagram and rearranges a paragraph of text
which was in the wrong place.

commit_message:
development-stack Doc Update

This patch changes how a development stack should be setup,
referencing the use of the bootstrap and run-playbook scripts
instead of the gate-check-commit script as this is generally
better practise. We have found that people end up running
the gate-check-commit script repeatedly instead of just
running a specified playbook.

This patch also adds the ceilometer containers to the
development stack diagram and rearranges a paragraph of text
which was in the wrong place.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I020fa857dbafd72ffce7141616b61874dcf84047

"manages actual object,such as files, on the storage nodes".
A space was added before such.

Closes-Bug: #1482093

commit_message:
Revert failing tests and use v3 for ec2 tokens

Domain users are not supported anymore on v2, so we need to use v3 by
default when authenticating ec2 access.

Change-Id: Ia7ca08bca612b4555f6b4d9098cd7db6c540b1c4
Closes-Bug: #1484086

free capacity are used to filter the host. If oversubscription ratio
exceeds max oversubscription ratio, the host is filtered out. If

compare virtual free capacity with volume size. Also the current
formula for computing virtual free capacity is incorrect.

The correct formula is:

commit_message:
Fix capacity filter to not use virtual free space

If thin provisioning is enabled, oversubscription ratio and virtual
free capacity are used to filter the host. If oversubscription ratio
exceeds max oversubscription ratio, the host is filtered out. If
oversubscription ratio is less than or equal to max oversubscription
ratio then virtual free capacity is compared with volume size to
filter the host. But oversubscription ratio is computed using the
volume size and if it's less than or equal to max oversubscription
ratio, the host is an eligible candidate provided the free space
(free_capacity - total*reserved) is non-zero. Also the current
formula for computing virtual free capacity is incorrect.

The correct formula is:
free_virtual = total * max_over_subscription_ratio - provisioned_gb

Then,
free_virtual >= volume_size implies
max_over_subscription_ratio >= (provisioned_gb + volume_size)/total
which means
over_subscription_ratio <= max_over_subscription_ratio

This patch removes free_virtual computation and uses free space to
decide the eligibility of a host if thin provisioning is enabled
and provisioning ratio is less than or equal to max oversubscription
ratio.

Change-Id: Ifaff40dc87ec1e041c00614d78191a393eed3125
Closes-Bug: #1462606

commit_message:
Partially revert tempest/devstack changes

Partially reverts 377b8c7284ca7a3aa48677e1bc1ffe56bf87bd61

This commit made some seemingly innocuous changes to the
devstack script, but now devstack is failing to start in the gate.

So we revert the devstack changes and work from there.  (But
we keep the tempest changes.)

Change-Id: Idc3f4978bc04054e6b308ddc040e89eace5639df

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-17 13:51:55.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/tests/ha/test_rabbit.py', 'fuel_health/ha_base.py'], 'message': "Get RabbitMQ nodes names by IP from network roles

Currently it's possible to move RabbitMQ service away
from general management network using special network
role 'mgmt/messaging' in net template. Since mapping of
network roles (and IPs) to nodes is done during deployment
info serialization, OSTF can't find AMQP hosts IPs in
nodes information (it contains default networks only) in
such cases. So switching it to use 'network_metadata'
from Hiera DB in order to search AMQP hosts names by IP
addresses assigned to nodes for all network roles.

Also compare RabbitMQ nodes that are shown by command
`rabbitmqctl cluster status` with AMQP hosts from Hiera DB
instead of controller nodes.

Change-Id: I1fb9f358f9c3afca1b651bb973da40fc2f873737
Closes-bug: #1485580
Closes-bug: #1485489
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Get RabbitMQ nodes names by IP from network roles

Currently it's possible to move RabbitMQ service away
from general management network using special network
role 'mgmt/messaging' in net template. Since mapping of
network roles (and IPs) to nodes is done during deployment
info serialization, OSTF can't find AMQP hosts IPs in
nodes information (it contains default networks only) in
such cases. So switching it to use 'network_metadata'
from Hiera DB in order to search AMQP hosts names by IP
addresses assigned to nodes for all network roles.

Also compare RabbitMQ nodes that are shown by command
`rabbitmqctl cluster status` with AMQP hosts from Hiera DB
instead of controller nodes.

Change-Id: I1fb9f358f9c3afca1b651bb973da40fc2f873737
Closes-bug: #1485580
Closes-bug: #1485489

commit_message:
Make timezones translatable

Use timezone info in Babel to translate timezones.  Sort
timezones by offset.  Update format to:
    UTC -06:00: United States (Chicago) Time

Thanks amotoki for suggesting to use Babel to handle this!

Not updating environment_version in run_tests.sh because Babel isn't
a new requirement; it's just being made explicit.

Change-Id: I15d39b94d441e9e155870a0593d11e67e68f9bd9
Closes-Bug: #1333927
(cherry picked from commit 8c50905a29e96113e3ba60fdf346b62b67321931)

commit_message:
Provide unique names on taskflow operations

The vscsi taskflow operations should be given unique names.  If not, the
duplicate names can occur when there are multiple Virtual I/O Servers.

Change-Id: Ib095fec0d7a083d929e810112a08b4aa79ba7228
Closes-Bug: 1486045

commit_message:
Remove concatenation in csv file

The download CSV summary file from both the Admin and Project
overview pages includes concatenation in its contents.
The : needs to be included as part of the label so translators
have control of spacing. Note that the commas are part of the
CSV file format and should not be translated.

Change-Id: I13137fda9b3e93edf97a7539044e791d04017ea7
Closes-Bug: 1444135
(cherry picked from commit 472bf6789653a2ec4562b0f59fb59f0a7b9df7f5)

commit_message:
Add message of unmatched test group.

Message is called before exit(1)
with default logger implementation.
Result of
strace ./utils/jenkins/system_tests.sh \
-t test -w $(pwd) -j fuelweb_test -i $ISO_PATH -kK\
 -o --group=no_such_group
is here
http://paste.openstack.org/show/419341/

Change-Id: Ib47ecf80235c681788ce08f97ae121fbf9c1c7bd
Closes-Bug: #1485669

[{'created': '2015-06-08 08:10:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'msync: Create a post-merged hook

Puppet modules within a project can share a common set of file

In order to make the management of those files easier, and make the
change in a single place, then apply it everywhere a community project
call modulesync[1] has been created.

msync is run within a specific project containing various informations

* templates
* data
* list of managed modules
* credentials/namespace informations

commit_message:
msync: Create a post-merged hook

Puppet modules within a project can share a common set of file

In order to make the management of those files easier, and make the
change in a single place, then apply it everywhere a community project
call modulesync[1] has been created.

msync is run within a specific project containing various informations

* templates
* data
* list of managed modules
* credentials/namespace informations

It is run the following way

  msync update -b BRANCH -m "My Commit Msg"

It will then clone/update/submit a change for every repository listed
in the managed_modules.yaml file, applying the necessary changes.

An example of a msync module can be find here[2]

[1] https://github.com/puppet-community/modulesync
[2] https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-modulesync-configs

Change-Id: Icbe96e1a6ea260ca44a5c1cfc60b055ace60556b
Depends-On: I5203e3c7b84c808bef61542efd2c4d973729b425

commit_message:
Increase connect and request timeout for keystone

This change increases the connection and http-request timeouts for the
keystone backends. This change is an attempt to prevent sluggish apache
processes from causing haproxy to return a 503.

Change-Id: I72d93111e939c5bc1776fe3e5ed4beac16702876
Related-Bug: 1485644

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-17 12:29:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix API misimplementation for security groups

According to the Compute API reference [1], the 'description' parameter
is optional when creating a security group. But the current
implementation returns a HTTP 400 when this parameter is not specified.

This patch modifies the validation check, so that omitting 'description'
or passing an empty string is OK.

[1]: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html#createSecGroup

Change-Id: I404dd30c7dac4b8a9e01cf2ea62fa404fdcce3de
Closes-Bug: #1434172

commit_message:
Fix API misimplementation for security groups

According to the Compute API reference [1], the 'description' parameter
is optional when creating a security group. But the current
implementation returns a HTTP 400 when this parameter is not specified.

This patch modifies the validation check, so that omitting 'description'
or passing an empty string is OK.

[1]: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html#createSecGroup

Change-Id: I404dd30c7dac4b8a9e01cf2ea62fa404fdcce3de
Closes-Bug: #1434172

commit_message:
Fix for Isilon driver failing to connect

Fixes a bug where the Isilon driver fails to connect due to an Isilon
configuration option ('isilon_share_root_dir') not being added to the
parent (EMC) driver.

Change-Id: Iff7f2b0dd66d427f366c961e5a3d8ce499a3ffe3
Closes-Bug: #1484238

commit_message:
Remove unused locales

Remove locales that have been imported in the past from
openstack-manuals but are not used for translation of operations-guide
currently. The last import was September 2014, so the files are not only
unused but also outdated.

We can easily add them whenever translations are available.

Change-Id: Ia9aca400d8aeac4532f211f454000b93266cdec1

subject: Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-18 15:44:27.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/db/test_db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/db/db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/api/rule_model.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"

This reverts commit 1cec4a6602d0cb29f9b876ce5a9133ce017d5bca.

This change fails on MySQL since it declares a column of arbitrary 
length to be Unique.  MySQL requires Unique columns to have a fixed
length.

Change-Id: I8ff58fd85bbc4adc086b9799aaf9011f1d83cd7a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"

This reverts commit 1cec4a6602d0cb29f9b876ce5a9133ce017d5bca.

This change fails on MySQL since it declares a column of arbitrary 
length to be Unique.  MySQL requires Unique columns to have a fixed
length.

Change-Id: I8ff58fd85bbc4adc086b9799aaf9011f1d83cd7a

commit_message:
Enable debug logging for gate checks

This patch enables debug logging for all OpenStack services
in the gate checks to ensure that the maximum amount of
information is available for debugging gate check failures.

Change-Id: Ide583fa6dc06008641bbc10b1abcaa816e662337
Closes-Bug: #1482572
(cherry picked from commit 91ac17211abc7becc8e792b98b00458e91dab535)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-05 19:15:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow Sahara native urls and runtime urls to differ for datasources

When we consider things like Manila nfs shares as datasources,
the possibility arises that the native form of a datasource url
in Sahara may not be the same as the form of the url needed at
runtime in the cluster. Allow them to differ, so that we can
still record the Sahara native url form in JobExecution objects
for accurate reference while passing the correct runtime url
in job arguments, etc.

This is a base CR that will be further built on later. In this
change, native urls and runtime urls are always identical.

Change-Id: I53f4cf11320e112ffd0c4ae93b7d1f300df86878
Partial-implements: blueprint manila-as-a-data-source

commit_message:
Allow Sahara native urls and runtime urls to differ for datasources

When we consider things like Manila nfs shares as datasources,
the possibility arises that the native form of a datasource url
in Sahara may not be the same as the form of the url needed at
runtime in the cluster. Allow them to differ, so that we can
still record the Sahara native url form in JobExecution objects
for accurate reference while passing the correct runtime url
in job arguments, etc.

This is a base CR that will be further built on later. In this
change, native urls and runtime urls are always identical.

Change-Id: I53f4cf11320e112ffd0c4ae93b7d1f300df86878
Partial-implements: blueprint manila-as-a-data-source

commit_message:
Show helpful message when request body is not provided

Avoid showing python error when no or empty request body is provided
for creating or updating request, providing some useful information
instead.

Closes-Bug: #1468597
Closes-Bug: #1466872
Change-Id: Ie3afc7c3591b4c1338f76d00238c541a7c54bd0d

commit_message:
Remove redundant connection tests

These tests are vestiges of when connection would do module
loading.  test_module_loader covers these cases.

Change-Id: Ifd45c501a1eeaa4e966fdf56fce2cbde45f91155

Ability to detach Keystone from controllers

Second patchset

Adds the possibility to install Keystone on
separate node (non-controllers).

Partial blueprint: detach-components-from-controllers

Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

Use the log module form oslo_log library instead of the system
logging module for the service.vpn.plugin module.

commit_message:
Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db

The prior version used the policy engine to catch duplicate rules, but with
HA, there will be multiple writers to the database, so the database itself
should catch the duplciates.

This change makes the database catch duplicate rules, even if the original
rule string does not match.

Change-Id: Ic7a64676aa9732cad044f1fa666131f536f355db

subject: Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-18 15:43:14.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/db/test_db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/db/db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/api/rule_model.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"

This reverts commit 1cec4a6602d0cb29f9b876ce5a9133ce017d5bca.

This change fails on MySQL since it declares a column of arbitrary length to be Unique.  MySQL requires Unique columns to have a fixed length.

Change-Id: Ibea09f3ba78e12660f8f96b4ab4ae4d14bf5b06a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add a unique canonical_rule column to each Rule in the db"

This reverts commit 1cec4a6602d0cb29f9b876ce5a9133ce017d5bca.

This change fails on MySQL since it declares a column of arbitrary length to be Unique.  MySQL requires Unique columns to have a fixed length.

Change-Id: Ibea09f3ba78e12660f8f96b4ab4ae4d14bf5b06a

commit_message:
do not create tempest.conf from .sample file

tempest.conf.sample does not exist anymore* so we need to stop relying
on this file to create the tempest.conf configuration file.

* https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/c8a39b488b97dd876af39567f8096f15dd36b802

This patch drops the File resource that managed tempest.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1482949
Change-Id: I7c3d20a61aa88a25f1215cccb4cb36168eab05c5

subject: WSGI: make it work, and test it with acceptance
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-14 13:36:33.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/ceilometer_wsgi_apache_spec.rb', 'manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/ceilometer_wsgi_apache_spec.rb', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/ceilometer_api_spec.rb'], 'message': "WSGI: make it work, and test it with acceptance

* Finalize httpd service name support in API class following
  puppet-keystone model.
* Implement unit tests.
* Implement separated acceptance tests that deploy Ceilometer API in
  WSGI.

This patch aims to finalize and validate we can deploy Ceilometer API in
WSGI with puppet-ceilometer.
Also that we can update from eventlet to WSGI (it's tested in our beaker jobs).

Closes-bug: #1481532
Change-Id: I3695acf5522457837e079c36d68a0e35dbf6b72c
(cherry picked from commit 257a60ce79f00f96239d06d84c9660f14a31bd68)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
WSGI: make it work, and test it with acceptance

* Finalize httpd service name support in API class following
  puppet-keystone model.
* Implement unit tests.
* Implement separated acceptance tests that deploy Ceilometer API in
  WSGI.

This patch aims to finalize and validate we can deploy Ceilometer API in
WSGI with puppet-ceilometer.
Also that we can update from eventlet to WSGI (it's tested in our beaker jobs).

Closes-bug: #1481532
Change-Id: I3695acf5522457837e079c36d68a0e35dbf6b72c
(cherry picked from commit 257a60ce79f00f96239d06d84c9660f14a31bd68)

commit_message:
Replace '\r' with ' ' for prettytable

Table doesn't display well when there are '\r' in prettytable data.
Fixes it by replace '\r\n' with '\n' and '\r' with ' '.

Change-Id: I1fde6d33c211e9629ee0dbeab241eeba20f7b8d5

commit_message:
Add nameservers (dns) parameters

  Implement ability to use dns servers
  for nova network deployments.

  dns1: new parameter (first dns server)
  dns2: add ability to define it (second dns server)

  Defaults to undef because these dns options are optional

Change-Id: Id26c2784178990652197aa9af3fd19d949339d58

commit_message:
Fix Orchestration request parameters of stack_adopt API

1) Change the "environment" parameter to 'required=false'.
2) Change the "timeout_mins" parameter to 'required=false'.
3) Delete the "param_name-n" and "param_value-n" parameters
   because these parameters are combined into 'parameters'.

Change-Id: I6a816625c9195b75f319b64960c2c975b2a4eafe
Closes-bug: #1484431

commit_message:
Expand requirements to Kilo

This patch extends version specifications for python
depencencies in order to be able to build python-fuelclient
against both Juno and Kilo releases of OpenStack

commit_message:
Fix the log level in scheduler manage

Change the log level 'WARNING' to 'ERROR' in scheduler.manage.py.
Because if the log level is WARNING, The root cause can not be
found quickly when a new share creation fails in scheduler mode.
In other words, this log level is more suitable for 'ERROR'.

Change-Id: Ic6b5a7e84e9dd8c3381b2c3760c9dcc6d434f8ed
Closes-Bug: #1481745

commit_message:
Store volume size in bdms of image being registered

If a volume size is not provided to register_image, ec2api should anyway
store it in image bdm. Otherwise it will not be exposed in describe
image operation.

Change-Id: Ibf14ffabe77f8426fc9f35e557d1dfa34082fef1

subject: Add tox generated files to .gitignore
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-03 11:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'README.rst', 'AUTHORS', 'ChangeLog'], 'message': 'Add tox generated files to .gitignore

The AUTHORS and ChangeLog files are generated by tox and if
included in the commits they result in constant merge conflicts.

As these files are only needed for documentation builds which
are done by tox and always regenerated, the files have been
excluded from commits.

Change-Id: Id8e5565e101adbb1b935d9a6806de0b9fa43d026
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add tox generated files to .gitignore

The AUTHORS and ChangeLog files are generated by tox and if
included in the commits they result in constant merge conflicts.

As these files are only needed for documentation builds which
are done by tox and always regenerated, the files have been
excluded from commits.

Change-Id: Id8e5565e101adbb1b935d9a6806de0b9fa43d026

subject: Add missing "name" request parameter to create a role
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-18 14:11:55.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v3/wadl/identity-admin-v3.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v3/wadl/common.ent'], 'message': 'Add missing "name" request parameter to create a role

commit_message:
Add missing "name" request parameter to create a role

A description of a "name" request parameter of API, which creates a
role, is missing. So I add it.

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-identity-v3.html#createRole.

Change-Id: I0c2fa699765f4b09f29386068b1f8c25902aecf9
Closes-Bug: #1485576

commit_message:
Fix tests in test_network_configuration_validator

Two tests were failing:
* TestNetworkConfigurationValidatorProtocol.test_networks_meta_vips
* TestNetworkConfigurationValidatorProtocol.test_networks_meta_ip_range

They failed because tests expected strings in test data and ints
were provided instead.

Change-Id: I17e6ff1a8bb154038b04e32e29745e9085edb276
Closes-Bug: #1486002

commit_message:
replace jinja2 with python templating

replace jinja2 in
nailgun.nailgun.objects.node.Node.apply_network_template
to python templating

jinja2 was used to substitute tokenized aliases with NICs'
names in template
python Template is able to do same substitution by deriving
subclasses of Template
jinja2 is removed from here because other jinja2 features
should not be accessible with templates

fix is covered by unit test
test_add_node_with_cluster_network_template in
test_node_assignment_handler.TestAssignmentHandlers

Change-Id: I15e18b55654e38c29dedc84f1d480517513f62fa
Closes-Bug: #1483309

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-12 19:52:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/feature/qos' into merge-branch

This merge commit introduces QoS feature into Liberty release of
Neutron.

The feature is documented in: doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst
included with the merge patch.

It includes:

- QoS API service plugin with QoS policy and QoS bandwidth limit
  (egress) rule support;
- core plugin mechanism to determine supported rule types, with its ML2
  implementation;
- new agent extension manager;
- QoS agent extension with pluggable backend QoS drivers (Open vSwitch
  and SR-IOV support is included).

To extend network and port core resources with qos_policy_id attribute,
a new ML2 extension driver (qos) was introduced that relies on the QoS
core resource extension (the idea is that eventually we'll get a core
resource extension manager that can be directly reused by core plugins).

Agent-server interaction is based on:

- get_device_details() API that is extended with qos_policy_id;
- a new push/pull mechanism that allows agents and servers to
  communicate using oslo.versionedobjects based objects sent on the
  wire.

The merge includes the following types of test coverage:

- unit tests;
- functional tests for OVS agent, QoS agent extension, and low level
  ovs_lib changes;
- API tests to cover port/network qos_policy_id attribute and new QoS
  resources.

The client changes can be found at:

* https://review.openstack.org/189655
* https://review.openstack.org/198277

The team also prepared fullstack test but it needs to wait for client
merge before it can pass in the gate:

* https://review.openstack.org/202492

Gerrit does not show diff for merge changes that did not result in any
conflict, so to facilitate review, rely on the following steps:

- fetch the patch locally
- git fetch origin
- git diff origin/master...

Partially-Implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-qos
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-qos-ovs-bwlimiting
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-sriov-qos-with-bwlimiting
Change-Id: I92916d0e391791187e9a25ff172fb4b3504857b1

- get_device_details() method that is extended with qos_policy_id;
- a new push/pull mechanism that allows agents and servers to
  communicate using oslo.versionedobjects based objects sent on the
  wire.

The merge includes the following types of test coverage:

- unit tests;
- functional tests for OVS agent, QoS agent extension, and low level
  ovs_lib changes;
- API tests to cover port/network qos_policy_id attribute and new QoS
  resources.

The client changes can be found at:

* https://review.openstack.org/189655
* https://review.openstack.org/198277

The team also prepared fullstack test but it needs to wait for client
merge before it can pass in the gate:

* https://review.openstack.org/202492

Gerrit does not show diff for merge changes that did not result in any
conflict, so to facilitate review, rely on the following steps:

- fetch the patch locally
- git fetch origin
- git diff origin/master...

This merge also disables qos extension API tests until the service is
enabled in master gate.

Local changes apart from conflicts:
- updated down_revision for qos migration to reflect master expand head;
- disabled qos API tests with gate_hook.sh until we have it enabled in
  master gate;
- bumped oslo.versionedobjects requirement to reflect what is in
  openstack/requirements' global-requirements.txt

commit_message:
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/feature/qos' into merge-branch

Note to reviewers: gerrit diff for merge patches is very limited, and
leaving comments in global section won't scale, so please comment here:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qos-merge-back-review

This merge commit introduces QoS feature into Liberty release of
Neutron.

The feature is documented in: doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst
included with the merge patch.

It includes:

- QoS API service plugin with QoS policy and QoS bandwidth limit
  (egress) rule support;
- core plugin mechanism to determine supported rule types, with its ML2
  implementation;
- new agent extension manager;
- QoS agent extension with pluggable backend QoS drivers (Open vSwitch
  and SR-IOV support is included).

To extend network and port core resources with qos_policy_id attribute,
a new ML2 extension driver (qos) was introduced that relies on the QoS
core resource extension (the idea is that eventually we'll get a core
resource extension manager that can be directly reused by core plugins).

Agent-server interaction is based on:

- get_device_details() method that is extended with qos_policy_id;
- a new push/pull mechanism that allows agents and servers to
  communicate using oslo.versionedobjects based objects sent on the
  wire.

The merge includes the following types of test coverage:

- unit tests;
- functional tests for OVS agent, QoS agent extension, and low level
  ovs_lib changes;
- API tests to cover port/network qos_policy_id attribute and new QoS
  resources.

The client changes can be found at:

* https://review.openstack.org/189655
* https://review.openstack.org/198277

The team also prepared fullstack test but it needs to wait for client
merge before it can pass in the gate:

* https://review.openstack.org/202492

Gerrit does not show diff for merge changes that did not result in any
conflict, so to facilitate review, rely on the following steps:

- fetch the patch locally
- git fetch origin
- git diff origin/master...

This merge also disables qos extension API tests until the service is
enabled in master gate.

Local changes apart from conflicts:
- updated down_revision for qos migration to reflect master expand head;
- disabled qos API tests with gate_hook.sh until we have it enabled in
  master gate;
- bumped oslo.versionedobjects requirement to reflect what is in
  openstack/requirements' global-requirements.txt

DocImpact
APIImpact

Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-qos
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-qos-ovs-bwlimiting
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-sriov-qos-with-bwlimiting
Change-Id: I92916d0e391791187e9a25ff172fb4b3504857b1

commit_message:
Change redstack to only install server plugin

Using the Trove devstack plugin was dependent on having a
python-troveclient plugin also 'enabled.' This has been changed
so that there is no need to separately enable a client plugin.
The code to do so has therefore been removed.

Variables have been added/modified to control how the plugin
is installed, and how the client is installed within the plugin.

Change-Id: Ic984dab5acc75934c5e9de19ac8bc4e2a6c4049a
Depends-On: If5a76360249827c19759a5c90dc00f70c59c32cc

commit_message:
Fuel 7.0 UI changes

Update the Fuel 7.0 UX workflow and add
the dashboard tab. This commit focuses on the dashboard changes,
and the Nodes tab with sorting, filtering, and adding custom labels.
We are not changing the entire userguide with this commit.
Other commits will follow to change the rest.

Change-Id: I016222109971c42029e434b4917f0f8a18d92cae

commit_message:
Disable tempest swift tests when DEPLOY_SWIFT=no

Currently, if you do not deploy swift you will get a tempest failure
when running the swift tests. This patch adds
'tempest_service_available_swift: False' to user_variables.yml when
DEPLOY_SWIFT=no.

Closes-Bug: #1485945
Change-Id: I2aba46171263a7a54716d3ecbb0e6dc68e840d93

commit_message:
Generate ids in environment-apps-edit command

This commit adds helper function, that traverses resulting object-model
before sending it to API and replaces any occurances of ===id1===,
===id2===, etc. with generated uuids.
Helper function keeps track of already generated ids.

Targets blueprint: env-configuration-from-cli

Change-Id: Iea20a2601a5dc4b8f92c3e935074ac2d7828d005

Possibility to set values lower than min size for Disk Volumes

   - appropriate validation added
   - also fixed Disk Error state:
          situation when there is too small disk size for the assigned roles

Closes-Bug: #1484938

commit_message:
Make redirect type configurable

This change exposes a redirect type configuration variable so that a
user can specify if they want to use 'temp' or 'permanent' redirects.

This change allows a user to switch to use a 'temp' redirect type
because Mozilla Firefox and Google Chrome cache the responses of '301
Moved Permanently'. Some users have multi tenant environments that have
different URLs for Horizon dashboards (Ubuntu - /horizon, CentOS -
dashboard). '302 Found' is not cacheable response which solves the issue
for multitenant users.

Change-Id: I81694d0ddeebafec7824f5b275d5fb504cd302b1
Closes-Bug: 1385133
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
GlusterFS backup driver

This patch introduces GlusterFS storage as a backup target.
GlusterFS backup driver inherits from Posix backup driver[1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163647/

Implements: blueprint glusterfs-as-a-backup-driver
Change-Id: I4f0c36cdaa7cc417cb26bc1e908c6d107a71da35

commit_message:
Don't use context.elevated to get volume

Original Problem:
=================
Since the metadata(readonly and attached_mode) is stored in admin metadata,
normal user need `run context.elevated` to retrieves admin metadata.
The above way will bring a side effect. Normal user can also get
any volume which the user shouldn't access when the user knows the UUID.

Solution:
=========
Use context instead of context.elevated to get volume.
And add admin metadata to it.
Based on cinder-meetup-summer-2015 conclusion, we use the solution.
The solution will need extra database connection.

Change-Id: I06f21e7578b65a59c0fe4d3afe0e882ed73c4725
Closes-Bug: #1477625

commit_message:
Split Jenkins job names by distro name when it possible

To get full test group name from Jenkins job names like
'7.0.system_test.ubuntu.services_ha.ceilometer', let's split the
job names by distro name if it is in the job name.

Change-Id: I19a23a69b29d62f9c12641e68756caea2c7f538f
Closes-Bug:#1485308

commit_message:
Bind to IP in arping if requested IP already assigend

Arping can't detect duplicates if there is a second
activated interface on the same LAN. It can be worked
around by binding to the requested IP address when
trying to detect duplicates.

Change-Id: I3d47b85ddd1a8894e6a2526e1a42e9cbd0b4de52
Closes-Bug: #1463418

commit_message:
Addding spec for Objects update support in Sahara API

Current Sahara API doesn't support update of some objects,
which can be required by some other features.

Updates are already implemented for node group templates,
cluster templates, job binaries and data sources and should
be done for clusters, jobs, job executions and job binary
internals.

APIImpact

PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/jobs/{job_id}
PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/clusters/{cluster_id}
PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/job-executions/{job_execution_id}
PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/job-binary-internals/{job_binary_internal_id}

Change-Id: I591ffa587083ca94bbe402b8ba333f4a9a1b6b0e
blueprint: api-for-objects-update

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-29 09:33:55.000000000', 'files': ['etc/trove/trove-taskmanager.conf.sample'], 'message': 'Move guestagent settings to default section

The guestagent related settings are in the database section of the
taskmanager.conf.sample file.  If a user were to use this sample then
the guestagent related settings will not be read by the taskmanager
service because it expects these guestagent related settings to be
in the default section.  This fix moves the guestagent related
settings to the default section.

Change-Id: I8dbdf7abcfd5f2341831cc6daaf5cb14d8d42d61
Closes-Bug: #1459415
(cherry picked from commit 9b47609941d338da11e29d79f4a74e6b3bdd6e3b)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Move guestagent settings to default section

The guestagent related settings are in the database section of the
taskmanager.conf.sample file.  If a user were to use this sample then
the guestagent related settings will not be read by the taskmanager
service because it expects these guestagent related settings to be
in the default section.  This fix moves the guestagent related
settings to the default section.

Change-Id: I8dbdf7abcfd5f2341831cc6daaf5cb14d8d42d61
Closes-Bug: #1459415
(cherry picked from commit 9b47609941d338da11e29d79f4a74e6b3bdd6e3b)

commit_message:
Fix random fails test_validate_networks_not_in_db

In error message that was checked in tests, order of IDs
might differ between tests run. Now error message is
checked by regex and ids are compared without taking
order into account.

Change-Id: I358e9689742d3ea387c7e3765387394554b38cfc
Closes-Bug: #1485953

commit_message:
Metadefs Upgrade By JSON File

Currently, metadata definitions may be added, but, not upgraded
by a JSON file. This blueprint defines a new process for allowing
metadata definitions to be upgraded with a JSON file.

Change-Id: Ifff0c85d8ad36839cd2adab0cb34157e808ecfe6
Implements: blueprint metadefs-upgrade-by-json-file

Currently there is no way to upgrade metadata definitions
to the newest set. This change adds new command to glance-manage:

glance-manage db merge_metadefs

It allows user to merge metadata definitions that are stored
in files with data that exists in database. By default it prefers
existing data over new, but it can be changed by using --prefer_new
flag so it will prefer new data over existing data in database.

commit_message:
Provide a way to upgrade metadata definitions

Currently there is no way to upgrade metadata definitions to the
newest set. This change extends existing command:
glance-manage db load_metadefs.

The extension allows user to merge metadata definitions that are
stored in files with data that exists in database. By default it
prefers existing data over new (--merge), but it can be combined
with other options to change this logic. Use --prefer_new flag so
it will prefer new data over existing data in database or
--overwrite so it will drop every namespace (and attached
resources) found in both, database and file.

By default glance-manage db load_metadefs works the same way it
worked before extension. To enable new logic user needs to
provide at least --merge option (or combine it with other two
options)

Implements: blueprint metadefs-upgrade-by-json-file
Change-Id: I55fa6640142db5110deb88d9ecd8507e7f533c58

commit_message:
fix rally scenarios

1. ec2_servers has been commited to rally and our ec2_server object
now conflicts with rally`s. in this patchset our object has been renamed.

2. rally now doesn't save context between runs. it passes original context
to each run. before this feature we stored something in context and
didn't count first run. moved to using global var of ec2 plugin.
rally was changed here - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203911/9

3. added route tables preparation for floating ip associating.

4. Scenarios was refactored in rally
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/212831/3

Change-Id: I57d6298a8ae734720f68a0caf2b36c92f32893b0

commit_message:
Catch v3 keystone unauthorized error when creating stack

If v3 keystone unauthorized error raise during creating stack,
then this stack will remaid in status of create_in_progress. This
patch modify heat keystoneclient to catch unauthorized error and
set stack status to failed.

Closes-Bug: #1376213
Change-Id: I9a34c20fc6ac3ce235aaba4eac25a6d5ceb43f5f

commit_message:
Set the node_id param as a required property

The node_id property is a required property to perform the re-assigning
a node with a given ID from one cluster to another.

Change-Id: I2442442260f19833db239b01856d0ff4f63ecfbb
Closes-Bug: #1483239

commit_message:
[Manila] Add share networks context for existing users

Add context for share networks that will be used in case of usage deployment
with existing users. Provided share networks via context option
"share_networks" will be balanced between all share creations of scenarios.

Change-Id: Ibdd55c3a41659b5b0eb634787bad29a9f7b83b55

subject: Pin heat and neutron
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-18 10:19:47.000000000', 'files': ['toci_devtest.sh'], 'message': "Pin heat and neutron

Pinning both heat and neutron to a version from Aug 7th when our
CI jobs worked. I think a combination of regressions in both of
these is causing our CI to fail.

We don't currently have logs to open an informed bug as logs
arn't being retrieved from the overcloud nodes we only know that
the overcloud stack is timing out.

Change-Id: If5852d8e4e942aaa0a2ed87cef983b8ece2aad4b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pin heat and neutron

Pinning both heat and neutron to a version from Aug 7th when our
CI jobs worked. I think a combination of regressions in both of
these is causing our CI to fail.

We don't currently have logs to open an informed bug as logs
arn't being retrieved from the overcloud nodes we only know that
the overcloud stack is timing out.

Change-Id: If5852d8e4e942aaa0a2ed87cef983b8ece2aad4b

install works.

commit_message:
Disallow set node label with empty key CLI v2

Label's key can not be empty string, so need to handle this case and raise error

Change-Id: I23919d26f29246dd392ae44738cc79579b64507a
Closes-Bug: #1484099

', 'number': 10}, {'created': '2015-08-10 17:29:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "3PAR: Adding performance metrics for load balanced provisioning

For load balanced virtual volume provisioning, it is necessary to have 
access to real time performance metrics (IO/s, KB/s, IO/B, and service time)
from a 3PAR array. This data is available from the 3PAR CLI, but currently 
there's no way to use the 3PAR CPG performance data in the filter/goodness 
function used by the evaluator/scheduler for load balancing volume 
placement among multiple 3PAR backends. 

In cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py, adds a call to
getCPGStatData, which calls the srstatld CLI command for performance 
metrics depending on the appropriate client API version, and uses the 
output to populate new fields in the output of get_volume_stats. 

In cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py, adds unit tests in
TestHP3PARFCDriver.test_get_volume_stats and in
TestHP3PARISCSIDriver.test_get_volume_stats. Also fixes assertEqual calls so
that they comply with the convention assertEqual(expected, actual).

Closes-bug: #1482741

Change-Id: If9e7b5ffd100489af6537f7dab970d89a6d70851
", 'number': 11}, {'created': '2015-08-10 19:34:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "3PAR: Adding performance metrics for load balanced volume placement

For load balanced virtual volume placement, it is necessary to have
access to real time performance metrics (throughput, bandwidth, latency,
IO size)from a 3PAR array. This data is available from the 3PAR CLI, but
currently there's no way to use the 3PAR CPG performance data in the
filter/goodness function used by the evaluator/scheduler for virtual volume
placement among multiple 3PAR backends.

In cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py, adds a call to
getCPGStatData, which calls the srstatld CLI command for performance
metrics depending on the appropriate client API version, and uses the
output to populate new fields in the output of get_volume_stats.

In cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py, adds unit tests in
TestHP3PARFCDriver.test_get_volume_stats and in
TestHP3PARISCSIDriver.test_get_volume_stats. Also fixes assertEqual calls so
that they comply with the convention assertEqual(expected, actual).

Closes-bug: #1482741

Change-Id: If9e7b5ffd100489af6537f7dab970d89a6d70851
", 'number': 12}, {'created': '2015-08-10 22:44:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '3PAR: Adding performance metrics for load balancing volume placement

If one storage backend has high load while another has lower load, when a
user/admin creates a volume, the current evaluator/scheduler may place the
volume on the backend with higher load. Instead the evaluator/scheduler should
always place that volume on the backend with the lowest load for load balancing
purposes. In general, for load balancing virtual volume placement, an
evaluator/scheduler needs access to real time performance metrics (e.g.
throughput, bandwidth, latency, IO size) which Cinder does not have currently.

These performance metrics are available from the 3PAR CLI, but they are
currently inaccesible in the evaluator/scheduler. The proposed changes make it
possible to define filter and goodness functions in /etc/cinder/cinder.conf
which include 3PAR CPG performance metrics. Note that the filter and goodness
functions are used by the evaluator/scheduler to evaluate where to place a
new volume among multiple 3PAR backends. Thus, the proposed changes give the
evaluator/scheduler access to the real time performance metrics necessary
for load balancing volume placement.

In cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py, uses the 3PAR client method
HP3parClient.getCPGStatData to get performance metrics, and adds new fields in
the output of HP3ParClient.get_volume_stats corresponding to the performance
metrics: throughput, bandwidth, latency, io_size, queue_length, and
avg_busy_perc.

In cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py, adds unit tests in
TestHP3PARFCDriver.test_get_volume_stats and in
TestHP3PARISCSIDriver.test_get_volume_stats. Also fixes assertEqual calls so
that they comply with the convention assertEqual(expected, actual).

Closes-bug: #1482741

Change-Id: If9e7b5ffd100489af6537f7dab970d89a6d70851
', 'number': 13}, {'created': '2015-08-10 23:19:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '3PAR: Adding performance metrics for load balancing volume placement

If one storage backend has high load while another has lower load, when a
user/admin creates a volume, the current evaluator/scheduler may place the

always place that volume on the backend with the lowest load for load balancing
purposes. In general, for load balancing virtual volume placement, an
evaluator/scheduler needs access to real time performance metrics (e.g.
throughput, bandwidth, latency, IO size) which Cinder does not have currently.

These performance metrics are available from the 3PAR CLI, but they are
currently inaccesible in the evaluator/scheduler. The proposed changes make it
possible to define filter and goodness functions in /etc/cinder/cinder.conf
which include 3PAR CPG performance metrics. Note that the filter and goodness
functions are used by the evaluator/scheduler to evaluate where to place a
new volume among multiple 3PAR backends. Thus, the proposed changes give the
evaluator/scheduler access to the real time performance metrics necessary
for load balancing volume placement.

In cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py, uses the 3PAR client method
HP3parClient.getCPGStatData to get performance metrics, and adds new fields in
the output of HP3PARCommon.get_volume_stats corresponding to the performance
metrics: throughput, bandwidth, latency, io_size, queue_length, and
avg_busy_perc.

In cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py, adds unit tests in
TestHP3PARFCDriver.test_get_volume_stats and in
TestHP3PARISCSIDriver.test_get_volume_stats. Also fixes assertEqual calls so
that they comply with the convention assertEqual(expected, actual).

Closes-bug: #1482741

balancing virtual volume placement, an evaluator/scheduler needs
access to real time performance metrics (e.g. throughput, bandwidth,
latency, IO size) to measure load, which Cinder does not have
currently.

Although these performance metrics are available from the 3PAR CLI,
they are currently inaccesible in the evaluator/scheduler. The
proposed changes make it possible to define filter and goodness
functions in /etc/cinder/cinder.conf which include 3PAR CPG
performance metrics. Note that the filter and goodness functions are
used by the evaluator/scheduler to evaluate where to place a new
volume among multiple 3PAR backends. Thus, the proposed changes give
the evaluator/scheduler access to the real time performance metrics
necessary for load balancing volume placement.

In cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py, uses the 3PAR
client method HP3parClient.getCPGStatData to get performance metrics,
and adds new fields in the output of HP3PARCommon.get_volume_stats
corresponding to the performance metrics: throughput, bandwidth,
latency, io_size, queue_length, and avg_busy_perc.

In cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py, adds unit tests in
TestHP3PARFCDriver.test_get_volume_stats and in
TestHP3PARISCSIDriver.test_get_volume_stats. Also fixes assertEqual
calls so that they comply with the convention assertEqual(expected,
actual).

Closes-bug: #1482741

commit_message:
3PAR: Adding performance metrics to volume status

If one storage backend has high load while another has lower load,
when a user/admin creates a volume, the current evaluator/scheduler
may place the volume on the backend with higher load. In many cases,
the evaluator/scheduler should place that volume on the backend
with the lowest load for load balancing purposes. In general, for load
balancing virtual volume placement, an evaluator/scheduler needs
access to performance metrics (e.g. IOPS throughput, bandwidth,
latency, IO size) to measure load, but Cinder drivers don't generally
report those metrics.

Although these performance metrics are available from the 3PAR CLI,
they are currently inaccesible in the evaluator/scheduler. The
proposed changes add these metrics to the volume status report and
thus make them accesible by the evaluator/scheduler.

In cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py, uses the 3PAR
client method HP3parClient.getCPGStatData to get performance metrics,
and adds new fields in the output of HP3PARCommon.get_volume_stats
corresponding to the performance metrics: IOPS throughput, bandwidth,
latency, io_size, queue_length, and avg_busy_perc. These metrics are
taken by averaging samples taken once per day for the last week.

In cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py, adds unit tests in
TestHP3PARFCDriver.test_get_volume_stats and in
TestHP3PARISCSIDriver.test_get_volume_stats.

Closes-bug: #1482741

Change-Id: If9e7b5ffd100489af6537f7dab970d89a6d70851

[{'created': '2015-05-14 10:04:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cinder v2 create and update api returns 500

If you pass name or description parameter with long string
of more than 255 characters to volume create api and volume
update api, then it returns 500 error code.

Added a check to validate string limit and returned 400 if
limit exceeds and removed leading and trailing white spaces
before add/update db record.

Closes-Bug: 1454244
Change-Id: Iaf7159e816f69fd776a09828c3bc1d27fc9fdcdb

commit_message:
Validate name and description string

If you pass name or description parameters with more than 255
characters to create and update apis of volume and snapshot
and create api of backup, then it returns 500 error code.

Added new method validate_name_and_description() in
cinder.api.openstack.wsgi.Controllera to validate string limit and
returned 400 if limit exceeds and also removing leading or trailing
whitespaces and string containing only whitespaces.

APIImpact
1. For all above APIs 400 response will be returned.
2. Earlier it was possible to pass only whitespaces or leading-trailing
   spaces to 'name' parameter.
   Now it will raise 400 error if only whitespaces are passed and will
   remove leading-trailing spaces if present in other cases.

Closes-Bug: 1454244
Change-Id: Iaf7159e816f69fd776a09828c3bc1d27fc9fdcdb

commit_message:
Bump hacking version

global requirements as of stable/kilo list

hacking>=0.10.0,<0.11

but Ironic stable/kilo still uses <0.10.

Manually bump the hacking version and fix arising violations.

Change-Id: I99d0c18ec773b2e72d3a9e83a1d4ff8d49d1ca6a

commit_message:
ml2: Fix typo with ml2_srvio/supported_pci_vendor_devs param.

This commit just fix the typo with supported_pci_vendor_devs param.

Please see:
http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/config-reference/content/networking-plugin-ml2_sriov.html

Closes-Bug: #1482322

commit_message:
Enable cinder-manage to remove services

These changes are to enable cinder-manage to remove old services
from the database like nova does. All that is being added is the remove
method to manage.py and tests to cover this new method in test_cmd.py.
The command will remove the binary from the list of running services
in the db that can be viewed via "cinder-manage service list". NOTE:
Active and restarted services will re-populate the DB with their current
status automatically.

To use this new command, the user types "cinder-manage service remove
<binary> <host>" and the service will be removed.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3bcec824d3c5f65fdd187459428025993a2010a0
Implements-blueprint: add-cinder-service-removal

commit_message:
Enable ceilometer in devstack

Magnum is going to send metrics/notifications to ceilometer. The
metrics will be leveraged to trigger ceilometer alarms, which is
needed to achieve autoscaling bay.

Change-Id: Ib80c9ab699a72701cefc4dfeb7f2542cecd8f2c9
Partially-Implements: blueprint autoscale-bay
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-notifications

subject: Stop using naturalSort in hypervisors table
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-18 10:36:19.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/hypervisors/tables.py'], 'message': "Stop using naturalSort in hypervisors table

In some situations, JS's naturalSort sorts hypervisor_hostname in
an unusual order. For example, this is a usually ordered list:

  east-01, east-02, west-01, west-02

while the result made by naturalSort is:

  east-01, west-01, east-02, west-02

Also, this is inconsistent with the other tables as they are using
datatable's default sort. Actually, the default sort does natural
ordering to numbers in text. So we can use the default sort instead
of naturalSort without a problem.

As the hypervisor table is the only user of naturalSort, all stuff
for naturalSort were removed.

Change-Id: I895d68f5c58e811e7200fbd110ab11f874f00b12
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop using naturalSort in hypervisors table

In some situations, JS's naturalSort sorts hypervisor_hostname in
an unusual order. For example, this is a usually ordered list:

  east-01, east-02, west-01, west-02

while the result made by naturalSort is:

  east-01, west-01, east-02, west-02

Also, this is inconsistent with the other tables as they are using
datatable's default sort. Actually, the default sort does natural
ordering to numbers in text. So we can use the default sort instead
of naturalSort without a problem.

As the hypervisor table is the only user of naturalSort, all stuff
for naturalSort were removed.

Change-Id: I895d68f5c58e811e7200fbd110ab11f874f00b12

subject: storage: remove create_metric()
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-18 10:36:14.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/rest/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/storage/ceph.py', 'gnocchi/storage/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_aggregates.py', 'gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/storage/swift.py', 'gnocchi/statsd.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_storage.py', 'gnocchi/storage/null.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_rest.py', 'gnocchi/storage/file.py'], 'message': "storage: remove create_metric()

This changes the storage driver API so that there's no need to create
metric before adding metrics. We let the indexer be responsible for the
status of a metric to be existing or non existing, and we allow the
storage driver to create metric on the fly.

Pros:

1. Speeds up the metric creation process as we do not need to reach the
   storage to create a container + empty archives
2. Avoid us for a COMMIT/ROLLBACK step we would have to handle in the
   metric creation process, in the case where creating a metric either
   storage or indexer would fail  we would have to rollback the
   creation that did not fail.

Cons:

1. We now acknowledge that it's more difficult to have an autonomous
   storage driver working without an indexer. While this was no obvious
   before Gnocchi 1.0.0, it's getting pretty clear now that we don't
   want to bypass the indexer as it's anyway responsible for things such
   as RBAC. And we can anyway cache him.

This will help fixing bug #1483634 since we'll be able to create metric
only in the indexer, doing that in only one single transaction.

This change also handles correctly deletion of unprocessed measures for
metrics that has been deleted.

Change-Id: I81ff5ca5540a8a02d378c289bed611a1329f9325
Related-Bug: #1483634

file: do not try to delete measure path

This is done when deleting the metric and is enough. That avoids
re-creating it on each new measure.

Change-Id: I1134f953f2b9af91973c898d2140aba5992f075f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
storage: remove create_metric()

This changes the storage driver API so that there's no need to create
metric before adding metrics. We let the indexer be responsible for the
status of a metric to be existing or non existing, and we allow the
storage driver to create metric on the fly.

Pros:

1. Speeds up the metric creation process as we do not need to reach the
   storage to create a container + empty archives
2. Avoid us for a COMMIT/ROLLBACK step we would have to handle in the
   metric creation process, in the case where creating a metric either
   storage or indexer would fail  we would have to rollback the
   creation that did not fail.

Cons:

1. We now acknowledge that it's more difficult to have an autonomous
   storage driver working without an indexer. While this was no obvious
   before Gnocchi 1.0.0, it's getting pretty clear now that we don't
   want to bypass the indexer as it's anyway responsible for things such
   as RBAC. And we can anyway cache him.

This will help fixing bug #1483634 since we'll be able to create metric
only in the indexer, doing that in only one single transaction.

This change also handles correctly deletion of unprocessed measures for
metrics that has been deleted.

Change-Id: I81ff5ca5540a8a02d378c289bed611a1329f9325
Related-Bug: #1483634

file: do not try to delete measure path

This is done when deleting the metric and is enough. That avoids
re-creating it on each new measure.

Change-Id: I1134f953f2b9af91973c898d2140aba5992f075f

commit_message:
fix test test_templates_not_found

Fix random fails (AssertionError) for test test_templates_not_found
in test_network_template_validator.NetworkTemplateValidatorTest

Names of templates in error message were returned in
different order (they were not sorted) and assert could fail.

Bug was reopened due merge issues

Change-Id: Ibd27b3c04849e230f4a04379703dd6984afbc78e
Closes-Bug: #1483744

commit_message:
nova-compute daemon misses libvirt python package on start

source based nova-compute needs libvirt to operate and fails
on start if the corresponding python package is missing.

Change-Id: Ic11bb46f8d067ce63013808ccc3efd17e67a5b83
Closes-Bug: #1485654

commit_message:
Use service_endpoint as endpoint for environment

To enable granular deployment of keystone, we need to know
precisely where keystone will be configured, as we dont have
such API in nailgun, we need to invent some convention.

Important to remember that we also need proxy on port 8888 configured
on a node that consumes configured vip.

Related-Bug: #1470927
Related bp ostf-separate-services-refactor
Change-Id: Ie497bca8818cd0f24eb40df32df227152254a69d

commit_message:
Add new repository for stand-alone TOSCA Parser

The heat-translator project currently contains two components - Translator and
TOSCA Parser. In order to use them independently we want to split them to
their own repo so that they can be offered as a stand-alone PyPI packages. I
have discussed it with the Heat PTL and he is okay with splitting the repos.

Change-Id: Ie02baa22737474f4402f17906ec1e7ff100357d2

commit_message:
Update openstack-ansible repository list

As the move of the stackforge projects into the openstack namespace
has not been scheduled, nor has the renaming of os-ansible-deployment
to openstack-ansible been scheduled [1], This patch adds the stackforge
repositories to the list in order to ensure that ATC's are recognised
from contributions to the project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/200730

Change-Id: Ia1c11223e5a73446c8c17400e53865830353cbfa

commit_message:
storage: remove mongodb_replica_set option

This option is not needed as you can pass the option into the MongoDB
URL.

commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues in Windows tests

* Replace __builtin__ with six.moves.builtins
* tox.ini: add the following tests to Python 3.4

  - cinder.tests.unit.windows.test_smbfs
  - cinder.tests.unit.windows.test_vhdutils
  - cinder.tests.unit.windows.test_windows
  - cinder.tests.unit.windows.test_windows_remotefs
  - cinder.tests.unit.windows.test_windows_utils

This change requires the Python 3 fixes in os-brick.

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I1ffa65745923459e993e81d8a95a39e19c1bd1e4

[{'created': '2015-08-10 11:41:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Re-order resource creation from yaml file

Current implementation makes following order:
  port(eth2)->port(eth2.102)->port(eth3)->port(eth3.103)
    ->ifconfig(eth2.102)->ifconfig(eth3.103)

Proposed changes modify prdering to:
  port(eth2)->port(eth2.102)->ifconfig(eth2.102)->
  port(eth3)->port(eth3.103)->ifconfig(eth3.103)

commit_message:
Re-order resource creation from yaml file

Current implementation makes following order:
  port(eth2)->port(eth2.102)->port(eth3)->port(eth3.103)
    ->ifconfig(eth2.102)->ifconfig(eth3.103)

Proposed changes modify prdering to:
  port(eth2)->port(eth2.102)->ifconfig(eth2.102)->
  port(eth3)->port(eth3.103)->ifconfig(eth3.103)

Change-Id: Ia9dcb3afdf9bad7cfc28ad8881d5c9b6e6473052
Closes-bug: #1452617

Previously runonce suffered from the following limitations:

1. Could only be run once.
2. Had hardcoded parameters.

This patch adds idempotentcy, allowing the tool to be safely run

commit_message:
Refactors tools/initrunonce

Previously runonce suffered from the following limitations:

1. Could only be run once.
2. Had hardcoded parameters.

This patch adds idempotentcy, allowing the tool to be safely run
more than once. Additionally, config options have been
parameterized providing flexibility for different dev environments.

Existing defaults have been persevered for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I7da3ef430b1ef6a412aae7d42bf1db79682b64d1

subject: [update|delete]_firewall: make it use a single transaction
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 8124, 'name': 'cbrandily', 'email': 'zzelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'cbrandily'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys'}, {'_account_id': 10692, 'name': 'Brocade Vyatta CI', 'email': 'DL-GRP-VYATTA-OSS@Brocade.com', 'username': 'brocade-oss-service', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14010, 'name': 'Ray Schneider', 'email': 'rmschn@gmail.com', 'username': 'rmschn'}, {'_account_id': 15330, 'name': 'Intel NGFW CI', 'email': 'ngfw-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'ngfwci'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-18 00:04:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/db/firewall/firewall_db.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin.py'], 'message': '[update|delete]_firewall: make it use a single transaction

update_firewall: fetching of the resulting firewall object should be
executed in the same transaction that modifies the object, to make sure
the db consistency context for all three steps is the same.

delete_firewall: fw_with_rules fetch should belong to the same
transaction as the one that is used to update the firewall status,
otherwise we may end up sending wrong status to the agent in
delete_firewall RPC payload.

Closes-bug: #1483875
Change-Id: I90eea61a329d896af4bef336ff336d0ee3f9ead9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[update|delete]_firewall: make it use a single transaction

update_firewall: fetching of the resulting firewall object should be
executed in the same transaction that modifies the object, to make sure
the db consistency context for all three steps is the same.

delete_firewall: fw_with_rules fetch should belong to the same
transaction as the one that is used to update the firewall status,
otherwise we may end up sending wrong status to the agent in
delete_firewall RPC payload.

Closes-bug: #1483875
Change-Id: I90eea61a329d896af4bef336ff336d0ee3f9ead9

commit_message:
Rename function '_update_port_down'

The function _update_port_down is renamed to _get_agent_fdb
because it generates the fdb entries which are send to
related l2 agents, but the old name is hard to understand.

Change-Id: Ibd5447311361b62a18195a958cbdeb64fc685b24

commit_message:
Update Cisco ML2 classes and templates

Add and update classes for Nexus, Nexus VXLAN, and UCSM drivers.
Use INI provider for driver config except for Nexus switch config.

Co-Authored-By: Tim Swanson <tiswanso@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I78ddc6795394c4ad2b4da9ab0a2c2a2eed18c25f

revisions:

Amazon changes instance type immediately and returns when instance
in 'stooped' state. But our code can return when instance in
'resized' state and then can't start it. So this patchset adds some
waiting after confirm_resize to ensure that instance in right state.

Change-Id: I6ddeace63a3c448281ec17d1788c1eb22c594116
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-18 06:43:36.000000000', 'files': ['ec2api/api/instance.py'], 'message': "add more waiting to instance type change

Amazon changes instance type immediately and returns when instance
in 'stooped' state. But our code can return when instance in
'resized' state and then can't start it. So this patchset adds some

Change-Id: I6ddeace63a3c448281ec17d1788c1eb22c594116
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
add more waiting to instance type change

Amazon changes instance type immediately and returns when instance
in 'stooped' state. But our code can return when instance in
'resized' state and then can't start it. So this patchset adds some
waiting after confirm_resize to ensure that instance in right state.

Change-Id: I6ddeace63a3c448281ec17d1788c1eb22c594116

[test] Ensuring ha job is working when stonith is fully disabled

Monasca Notification resource plugin

Adds resource plugin and unit test cases for monasca
notification.

commit_message:
Fix postgresql unit tests running

- access to the "openstack_citest" db under the "openstack_citest" user
  in case if tests run on Jenkins gate, do not run commands under the
  'sudo' because sudo access is revoked on Jenkins gates
- add one more argument that determines in how many threads tests will be run
  (by default tests will be run in 1 thread, otherwise tests fail because of
   incorrect cleanup mechanism in unit tests)

Change-Id: If332e8661f9309f71a3a0174144026de99df463e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-24 20:29:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Split fuel-web repository in multiple components

The fuel-web repository currently contains lots of projects which
should be maintained independently: fuel_agent, nailgun,
network_checker, shotgun, tasklib, fuelmenu, and more. As a result,
it's hard to package fuel-web in a proper way, and there's no proper
versionning of each element. Separating them will make it possible
to build each individual component individually. Also, in the
current form, it's very hard to package the fuel-web repository for
distributions.

commit_message:
Split fuel-web repository in multiple components

The fuel-web repository currently contains lots of projects which
should be maintained independently: fuel_agent, nailgun,
network_checker, shotgun, tasklib, fuelmenu, and more. As a result,
it's hard to package fuel-web in a proper way, and there's no proper
versionning of each element. Separating them will make it possible
to build each individual component individually. Also, in the
current form, it's very hard to package the fuel-web repository for
distributions.

Change-Id: I2b6151c64b8476781e77e935a3612d8dd5e84918

commit_message:
Added package storrest that needed by the LSI feature

Added repo of Storrest, that needed for making storrert package
during the creation of iso. This package will be installed in bootstrap
and all openstack nodes to collect information about LSI/AVAGO Raids.

Implements: blueprint lsi-raid-controllers

Change-Id: Ifd8a45a8fbf231ad4e2e9190680654e5f75fc182

commit_message:
Set random password for root user

Random password will be set for root user.
For the first time it will be printed to console (stderr).
Also after the first use, the password will expire.

Change-Id: I0b5c0edaa6107eb90a73bae7cb546e27d50ec6b3
Closes-Bug: #1413456

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-08 15:39:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'IBP: do not resize images during build

Apparently, fuel-agent shunk the images to minimal size.
So images were resized twice:
* first, before the end of their building was done
* second, after image was deployed on target device

This first step should be skipped and images should be supplied
unresized at all.

It helps to avoid resize related issues such as producing
sub-optimal metadata layout which is under certain circumstances
may lead to performance degradation.

Also, resize is potentially dangerous operation that should be used
wisely. Lesser resizes is lesser issues.

commit_message:
IBP: do not resize images during build

Apparently, fuel-agent shunk the images to minimal size.
So images were resized twice:
* first, before the end of their building was done
* second, after image was deployed on target device

This first step should be skipped and images should be supplied
unresized at all.

It helps to avoid resize related issues such as producing
sub-optimal metadata layout which is under certain circumstances
may lead to performance degradation.

Also, resize is potentially dangerous operation that should be used
wisely. Lesser resizes is lesser issues.

Change-Id: If8de0e57a6ebb6260f98bcc5a9a8d0be034edb37
Closes-Bug: #1469155

commit_message:
IBP: add GRUB_RECORDFAIL_TIMEOUT for ubuntu

This timeout hasn't been set in default grub2 config.
If a provisioned node experiences unexpected reboot,
grub will refuse to boot after it and will expect for
user input for confirmation.

Setting it to 5secs should help to bypass that confirmation.

This change additionaly allow to set GRUB timeout via config file.

Change-Id: I48af989bc8ad4ccaf2939804614488588010fed2
Closes-Bug: #1465586
(cherry picked from commit 90ab1c79fe9a4fdac155ff872f87e53aaa72d6f7)

commit_message:
Getting of provision data via various sources for fuel-agent

Introduce 'provision_data_uri' flag to let it pulling of provision data from
various sources. Added 2 URI types: 'file://' and 'http://'.
Also it switches to fallback mode, if 'file://' was missing then trying to
interpreter given URI as a file path.

Partially implements: blueprint cobbler-ironic-substitute

Change-Id: I11323171064942ee313e7147159a84318539f38c

commit_message:
Ditch run_as_root kwarg from utils.execute from fuel-agent

Initially fuel-agent was using utils.execute from oslo with
run_as_root kwarg support. Once oslo's utils.execute became
inconvenient for our case, fuel-agent had been switched to custom
made utils.execute wrapper keeping its signature as close as possible
to oslo's one. run_as_root was never used, so it should be removed.

Change-Id: Ic037cbe697fc3912b10f5a7dc9be3eb75b473cc8

commit_message:
IBP: add http_proxy support to fuel-image

Add ability to fuel-image to fetch packages via http proxies.

* pass 'http_proxy' environment variable to debootstrap
* configure proxy per apt repos

commit_message:
Add default sorting to the Security Groups table.

The Security Groups table (Project > Access & Security) is initially
ordered by the group's uuid string which makes the table appear to be
randomly sorted. This patch adds a default sorting by the groups'
``name`` attributes.

Change-Id: Ica2831e043e2e7fec8129df4feee93f6c8be3462

Clone CG introduced new parameters in the driver CG interface
create_consistencygroup_from_src, but the drivers were not updated
to add the new parameters. This patch adds them for pure.py
and xtremio.py.

commit_message:
Fix missing parameters in driver CG interface

Clone CG introduced new parameters in the driver CG interface
create_consistencygroup_from_src, but the drivers were not updated
to add the new parameters. This patch adds them for pure.py
and xtremio.py.

Related patch for the VNX driver:
https://review.openstack.org/210319

Change-Id: I5ab121e00179f17408226d470917d165d7e38ddd
Closes-Bug: #1482733

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-30 13:58:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't allow DESTROY on conntrack entries

Prevent the DESTROY action on outbound conntrack entries so
TCP RST's do not take effect on them. For VMs on the same host,
the entry will be cleared as the packet goes through conntrack
again on the other VM's bridge. For VMs outside, the entries will
be left to timeout and expire.

Change-Id: Ibe9e49653b2a280ea72cb95c2da64cd94c7739da
Closes-Bug: #1478925
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-31 01:46:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use a conntrack zone per port in OVS

Conntrack zones per network are not adequate because VMs
on the same host communicating with each other cross iptables
twice. If conntrack is sharing the same zone for each cross,
the first one can remove the connection from the table on a RST
and then the second one marks the RST as invalid.

This patch adjusts the logic to use a conntrack zone per port
instead of per network. In order to avoid interrupting upgrades
or restarts, the initial zone map is built from the existing
iptables rules so existing port->zone mappings are maintained.

Closes-Bug: #1478925
Change-Id: Ibe9e49653b2a280ea72cb95c2da64cd94c7739da

commit_message:
Use a conntrack zone per port in OVS

Conntrack zones per network are not adequate because VMs
on the same host communicating with each other cross iptables
twice. If conntrack is sharing the same zone for each cross,
the first one can remove the connection from the table on a RST
and then the second one marks the RST as invalid.

This patch adjusts the logic to use a conntrack zone per port
instead of per network. In order to avoid interrupting upgrades
or restarts, the initial zone map is built from the existing
iptables rules so existing port->zone mappings are maintained.

Closes-Bug: #1478925
Change-Id: Ibe9e49653b2a280ea72cb95c2da64cd94c7739da

subject: Put kube_master into a resource group
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-28 19:45:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Put kube_master into a resource group

With this patch, k8s template support more than one master nodes.
The number of master nodes can be specified through Heat parameter.

For fault tolerance, the cluster tolerants failure of no more than
half of the size. For example, a cluster with 3 master node tolerant
failure of 1 master node. Below is the table:

SIZE TOLERANCE
1    0
3    1
4    1
5    2
6    2
7    3
8    3
9    4

Change-Id: Ic28c13bdcadb39949f9c50be45e09f7627c5d627

commit_message:
Put kube_master into a resource group

With this patch, k8s template support more than one master nodes.
The number of master nodes can be specified through Heat parameter.

For fault tolerance, the cluster tolerants failure of no more than
half of the size. For example, a cluster with 3 master node tolerant
failure of 1 master node. Below is the table:

SIZE TOLERANCE
1    0
3    1
4    1
5    2
6    2
7    3
8    3
9    4

Change-Id: Ic28c13bdcadb39949f9c50be45e09f7627c5d627
Partially-Implements: blueprint make-master-ha

commit_message:
Adds a pep8 target to tox.ini

The will now run flake8 on all Python files and bashate on all shell
scripts. Right now I'm ignoring the bashate errors, since there were so
many of them. Follow up patches will start fixing those issues.

A few Python files had minor modifications to pass flake8.

Change-Id: I5f773eb6ea9f1311aa045951ff9bdad16cca6491

commit_message:
Install-guide about basic networking.

In the test when localhost(127.0.0.1) is not disable in the host file, there will be shown "Name or Service not known".The existing note is clear about removing or commenting out 127.0.1.1 instead of 127.0.0.1.

Fixed bug #1459742

Change-Id: If484a506b027537f3de658f9156f102caff30f5a

commit_message:
DVR: fix router rescheduling on server side

This fixes router rescheduling for dvr routers to
correctly handle CSNAT portion rescheduling on server side.

Next patch will make L3 agent aware of possible SNAT role
rescheduling to/from it.

Partial-Bug: #1472205
Change-Id: I069500a2f1de9a734124544a3f2d793e9fa2d27c

Scheduling/unscheduling of DVR routers with l3 agents in 'dvr' mode
running on a compute nodes is done according to DVR serviced ports
created/deleted on that compute nodes. It doesn't make sense to reschedule
router from l3 agent on compute node even if it's down - no other l3 agent

commit_message:
DVR: do not reschedule router for down agents on compute nodes

Scheduling/unscheduling of DVR routers with l3 agents in 'dvr' mode
running on a compute nodes is done according to DVR serviced ports
created/deleted on that compute nodes. It doesn't make sense to reschedule
router from l3 agent on compute node even if it's down - no other l3 agent
can handle VMs running on that compute node.

Closes-Bug: #1470889
Change-Id: Ib998b9e459dd1a9ab740fafa5d84dc3211ca0097

There seems no need to overwrite some methods for wait
condition handle resources, due the implementations are
same as super class.

commit_message:
Fix ValueError when doing cluster_scale_in action

If a cluster contains no nodes, ValueError happens when
trying to scale-in the cluster. This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: I6094cdeecdd42c842176427a2a373783bcf843a8
Closes-Bug: #1485535

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-17 08:40:54.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/packages/views.py'], 'message': "Fix package view.py use wrong table meta attribute

Now here use the meat attribute 'pagination_param'
marker = self.request.GET.get(
             tables.PackageDefinitionsTable._meta.pagination_param, None)
But this meta attribute define in the tables as 'prev_pagination_param'

This patch fix it

Change-Id: Id129863fbe7492b77e6c0e6e737b8d9d2932bd0a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix package view.py use wrong table meta attribute

Now here use the meat attribute 'pagination_param'
marker = self.request.GET.get(
             tables.PackageDefinitionsTable._meta.pagination_param, None)
But this meta attribute define in the tables as 'prev_pagination_param'

This patch fix it
